additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

description.description: A short description of the item.

image.description: URL of an image of the item.

attendee.description: A person or organization attending the event.

attendees.description: A person attending the event (legacy spelling; see singular form, attendee).

duration.description: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.

endDate.description: The end date and time of the event (in ISO 8601 date format).

location.description: The location of the event or organization.

offers.description: An offer to sell this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, the DVD of a movie, or tickets to an event.

performer.description: A performer at the event—for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor.

performers.description: The main performer or performers of the event—for example, a presenter, musician, or actor (legacy spelling; see singular form, performer).

startDate.description: The start date and time of the event (in ISO 8601 date format).

subEvent.description: An Event that is part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each are a subEvent of the conference.

subEvents.description: Events that are a part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each are subEvents of the conference (legacy spelling; see singular form, subEvent).

superEvent.description: An event that this event is a part of. For example, a collection of individual music performances might each have a music festival as their superEvent.
